section.name: Hippo CMS Contributor Tour
section.span: To get introduced in the role of CMS Contributor, take the following tour.
section.p: To get introduced in the role of CMS contributor, you will look over the shoulder of Marc, who is a member of the imaginary organization Saraswatia, an organization of people very interested in music, art and knowledge. We did not imagine an answer to the question whether Saraswatia is a commercial organization, a hobby organization, or both.
Saraswatia decided to publish an online newspaper about music, art and knowledge. The name will be Sar, which is just an abbreviation of `Saraswatia Articles'.
Marc will add an article about an upcoming multicultural Bazar.

tr.td: Open the Hippo CMS site http://localhost:8080/cms/ in your browser.
Login to Hippo CMS in the CMS account given to you by your CMS administrator. Marc logs in with his name. His password is only known to him, so you do not get to see it.
Goto to the folder to add your document in. Marc learned that all articles for Saraswatia's online newspaper are supposed to go in the 'sar newspaper' document folder, so he selects that.

Create a document to write in. For the article about the upcoming multicultural bazaar, Marc creates a document named 'multibazar2008'. He selects for it the documenttype 'upcoming', because that is the type for upcoming happenings, like the bazaar.
Open the document to start writing. Marc opens the document named 'multibazar2008'.
Fill a date field. Marc sees that he is supposed to fill in on what date the happening, which in his case is the bazaar, will be. So he looks up the date and fills it in the document.
Fill a string field. Marc sees that he is supposed to type a title for the happening, which in his case is the bazaar, and he types 'Multicultural Bazaar 2008' as the title.

Fill a boolean field. Marc sees that he is supposed to answer the question whether the happening is indoors. The bazaar is not indoors, so he does not check that checkbox. He also is supposed to answer the question whether the happening is a recurring happening, i.e. a happening that has occurred before. This is the case, so he checks that checkbox.

Fill markuped text. Marc sees that he can also write a description of the happening and he writes an informative text about the upcoming multicultural bazaar. He includes the place where the bazaar will be in this description, because there is no separate field for it and people need to know.
request publication. Marc now requests publication of his article. Janine is the editor and she will receive this request and accept or reject it.
